description: Variable contents. Open for senior students interested in studying an advanced topic in statistics with a departmental faculty member.

title: Introduction to Technology
description: Introduction to technology concepts and applications.

title: Introduction to Systems Engineering
description: Introduction to systems engineering, industrial engineering/operations research areas (facility location, quality control, production planning, linear programming), automation/control concepts, and systems approach to engineering problems.

title: Engineering Probability and Statistics
description: Sample space, events, random variables, conditional probability, discrete/continuous distributions, functions of random variables, sampling distributions, estimation and hypothesis testing.

title: Modeling and Simulation
description: Principles of modeling, linear/nonlinear dynamic models, Laplace transform, system analysis, linearization, mechanical/electrical system modeling, transfer functions, state space models, analog/digital simulation.

title: Numerical Methods
description: Roots of nonlinear equations, linear/nonlinear systems solutions, numerical differentiation/integration, interpolation, least-squares approximation, ODE solutions, error analysis. *Note: Equivalent to MATH 321; only one can be taken for credit.*

title: Linear Control Systems
description: Linear systems analysis (time/frequency domains), stability, root locus, frequency response, compensator design (PID, lag, lead). *Note: Equivalent to EE 380; only one can be taken for credit.*

title: Operations Research I
description: Linear programming (simplex method, duality, sensitivity), network models (shortest path, PERT/CPM, transportation), queuing models.

title: Optimization Methods
description: Unconstrained/constrained optimization techniques, Karush-Kuhn-Tucker conditions, algorithms (SUMT, feasible directions), engineering case studies.

title: Engineering Economic Analysis
description: Economic decision-making concepts: worth analysis, cash flow equivalence, rate of return, replacement analysis, benefit-cost analysis, depreciation/taxes, break-even analysis.

title: Digital Systems Design
description: Binary arithmetic, Boolean algebra, logic gates, combinational/sequential circuit design, digital computer elements.

title: Instrumentation
description: Measurement systems, sensors (resistive, inductive, thermoelectric), signal conditioning, microcomputer-based instrumentation, flow/pressure/temperature measurement.

title: Signals & Systems
description: Continuous/discrete-time signals and systems, Fourier analysis, Z-transforms, random signal analysis, control/DSP applications.

title: Quality Control and Industrial Statistics
description: Control charts, process capability, quality audits, acceptance sampling, quality cost analysis, case studies.

title: Manufacturing Technology
description: Metal/plastic manufacturing methods (casting, forming, machining, welding), laboratory experiments.

title: Methods Engineering
description: Methods design, process/operation analysis, work measurement, predetermined motion-time systems, work sampling.

title: Engineering Statistics
description: Estimation/hypothesis testing applications, ANOVA, regression, experimental design, Taguchi methods.

title: Cooperative Work
description: Practical industry experience component.

title: Computer Control Systems
description: Computer control elements (A/D, D/A, sensors), control architectures, programmable controllers, distributed systems.

title: Production Systems and Inventory Control
description: Production forecasting, inventory systems, scheduling, MRP, capacity planning, computer applications.

title: Stochastic System Simulation
description: Discrete-event simulation modeling, random variables, output analysis, model validation, industrial applications.

title: Microprocessors in Automation Systems
description: Microprocessor architecture, software development, interfaces, automation case studies.

title: Industrial Process Control
description: Process modeling, identification techniques, advanced control strategies (PID, feedforward, internal model), digital control.

title: Operations Research II
description: Advanced topics: integer programming, dynamic programming, stochastic processes.

title: Facility Layout and Location
description: Facility planning, material handling, location/layout techniques, warehousing functions.

title: Maintenance Planning & Control
description: Maintenance organization, forecasting, replacement models, scheduling, productivity measurement.

title: Digital Signal Processing
description: Discrete-time systems, Z-transform, DFT/FFT, digital filter design. *Note: Equivalent to EE 406; only one can be taken for credit.*

title: Control Systems Design
description: Classical design techniques (lead/lag, PID), process identification, hardware implementation.

title: Introduction to Robust Control
description: Uncertainty modeling, H2/H‚àû optimal control, Œº-analysis/synthesis.

title: Instrumentation for Process Control
description: Process instrumentation, signal conditioning, sensors, controllers, data acquisition.

title: Special Topics in Automation
description: Current automation theory and practice.

title: Human Factors Engineering
description: Man-machine systems, displays, workspace design, environmental factors.

title: Decision Making
description: Decision structuring (single/multiple criteria), MCDM methods, game theory, case studies.

title: Sequencing and Scheduling
description: Scheduling algorithms, dynamic programming, integer programming, heuristic methods.

title: Special Topics in Industrial Engineering & Operations Research
description: Selected IE/OR topics.

title: Methodology for Large Scale Systems
description: Large-scale systems engineering, modeling tools, decomposition techniques, case studies.

title: Computer-Aided Manufacturing and Robotics
description: CAD/CAM fundamentals, manufacturing systems, robotics applications.

title: Theory of Stochastic Systems
description: Stochastic processes, Markov chains, Poisson processes, engineering applications.

title: Industrial Information Systems
description: Industrial information system design (planning, control, inventory, maintenance), case studies.

title: Industrial Safety
description: Occupational safety standards, administration, legal aspects.

title: Digital Computing Techniques I
description: Matrix algebra, SVD, linear systems, eigenvalue problems, Lyapunov/Riccati equations.

title: Digital Computing Techniques II
description: Numerical solutions for ODEs/PDEs, finite differences/elements, engineering applications.

title: Reliability & Maintainability
description: Reliability engineering, hazard functions, fault trees, maintainability concepts.

title: Systems Engineering Senior Project
description: Capstone design project incorporating curriculum components, real-world constraints, team projects allowed.

title: Special Topics in Industrial Engineering
description: Selected industrial engineering topics.

title: Industrial Engineering Design
description: Industrial engineering design principles.
